title: Quiz
content:
Chapter Quiz

Answer the following questions to check your understanding of this chapter's topics.

questions.question: In the context of 'Performance and Caching', which statement about batching & debouncing inputs is most accurate?
choices: Batching & Debouncing Inputs always requires external services to work in Streamlit.
Batching & Debouncing Inputs is useful in some cases, but you should evaluate complexity and UX trade-offs.
Batching & Debouncing Inputs is deprecated and should be avoided in all Streamlit apps.
Batching & Debouncing Inputs only works when running Streamlit in Docker.
questions.explanation: Batching & Debouncing Inputs is a powerful pattern, but like most advanced techniques, it should be used judiciously with attention to user impact and maintainability.

questions.question: In the context of 'Performance and Caching', which statement about st.cache_data deep dive is most accurate?
choices: st.cache_data Deep Dive always requires external services to work in Streamlit.
st.cache_data Deep Dive is useful in some cases, but you should evaluate complexity and UX trade-offs.
st.cache_data Deep Dive is deprecated and should be avoided in all Streamlit apps.
st.cache_data Deep Dive only works when running Streamlit in Docker.
questions.explanation: st.cache_data Deep Dive is a powerful pattern, but like most advanced techniques, it should be used judiciously with attention to user impact and maintainability.

questions.question: In the context of 'Performance and Caching', which statement about profiling streamlit apps is most accurate?
choices: Profiling Streamlit Apps always requires external services to work in Streamlit.
Profiling Streamlit Apps is useful in some cases, but you should evaluate complexity and UX trade-offs.
Profiling Streamlit Apps is deprecated and should be avoided in all Streamlit apps.
Profiling Streamlit Apps only works when running Streamlit in Docker.
questions.explanation: Profiling Streamlit Apps is a powerful pattern, but like most advanced techniques, it should be used judiciously with attention to user impact and maintainability.
